page.title: 10RELIGION BISHOP THORNTON
page.content: The C.E. Church is dedicated to St. John the Evangelist.and replaces the old church of St. John of which only the tower remains which stands in the fields in the middle of the parish. The Archbishop of York appointed a Forester for his hunting ground "chase". He was called John Wallworth and he lived at Raventoft's Hall. People grumbled as they had to walk 8 miles to the nearest church at Kirby Malzeard four times a year for holy days. So John Wallworth built them a church in the middle of the parish with five stone bridle paths from every side, in the year 1460. The new church was built in 1888. The vicar is Reverend S.D. Askew. The Roman Catholic Church priest is called Father Pepper. There is also a Methodist Church at Shaw Mills. Reverend C. Stark.
